data.title: It is Time to Put Steve Zahn in Everything
data.meta_description: As an actor on strike, I’ve been streaming a lot of reruns. Whenever Steve Zahn appears onscreen, I fist-pump so hard. I study his lines and gestures, murmuring, “How does he do it?” I am never not…
data.text:
As an actor on strike, I’ve been streaming a lot of reruns. Whenever Steve Zahn appears onscreen, I fist-pump so hard. I study his lines and gestures, murmuring, “How does he do it?”

I am never not happy to see him in The White Lotus, Treme, and Uncle Frank, all of which I recently re-binged. Twice. Steve Zahn has an everyman quality, if every man was from Minnesota and graduated from Harvard. His last name is German for “tooth.” Steve Zahn is toothsome.

Why isn’t Steve Zahn in everything? He’s a talented actor and funnier than a bespoke clown. I was a birthday party clown and my costume was not bespoke. Smelled like the last clown’s cigs after I totally spaced the dry cleaner’s. Not everybody goes to Harvard, right? I did take an acting class in Saugus once.

My Instagram feed is filled with actors and writers sweating on the picket line. But after the strike gets settled? Put Steve Zahn in each upcoming movie and scripted series, you cowards. We deserve more Steve in every romantic comedy, action film, drama, or short. Voice acting for animation. International cinema bookings. What time is it? Zahn o’clock!

Steve Zahn’s unavailable? Double-booked? That’s what technology is for. CGI Steve Zahn into the…
